abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column notes problems associated with artificial turf, including ubiquitous black rubber pellets that players continue to find on their clothing and bodies days after matches; admits that artificial turf is future of soccer, but says fact that 2015 Women's World Cup is first to be played exclusively on artificial turf is evidence that women in soccer are valued less than men, who get to play on grass.
lead_paragraph: With the Women’s World Cup being played on artificial turf, players face a plague of tiny rubber pellets used as fill between the blades of fake grass.

headline.main: At the Women’s World Cup, a Memento Players Are Stuck With and Stuck To
headline.print_headline: A Memento Players Carry With Them, Like It or Not

snippet: With the Women’s World Cup being played on artificial turf, players face a plague of tiny rubber pellets used as fill between the blades of fake grass.
